thread.title: In memoriam: Lincoln Chafee’s campaign for president
thread.title_full: In memoriam: Lincoln Chafee’s campaign for president

title: In memoriam: Lincoln Chafee’s campaign for president
text: He campaigned on his vote against the Iraq War, raising the minimum wage, protecting the environment, welcoming Edward Snowden home, and - of course - converting America to the metric system. CRAIG LASSIG / Reuters Over two fundraising quarters, Chafee raised about $40,000 from outside sources, including a total $11,000 in the third quarter. Jim Mone / AP NPR interviewed three of Chafee’s 10 itermized donors from the third quarter filing period, two of which were his friends. Even though they too didn’t believe he could win, they supported his “positive approach to life.” Cheryl Senter / The Boston Globe In August, late-night talk-show host Conan O’Brien tried to start a campaign to get Chafee to 1 percent in the polls. Cheryl Senter / The Boston Globe The former senator and governor usually drove himself while campaign across the Granite State. In this photo he checks over notes before the Rockingham County Democrats town hall in Sandown, New Hampshire. Cheryl Senter
